derivation: from G4862 (συγχύνω) and (to pour) or its alternate;
kjv_def: confound, confuse, stir up, be in an uproar
strongs_def: to commingle promiscuously, i.e. (figuratively) to throw (an assembly) into disorder, to perplex (the mind)
outline:
1. to pour together, commingle
  2. to disturb the mind of one, to stir up to tumult or outbreak
  3. to confound or bewilder
